text: Presidential elections were held in the Granadine Confederation in 1860, the first under the 1858 constitution. The elections were held during the 1860–62 civil war, but not in the parts of the country controlled by the Liberal Party, and the Liberal Party did not put forward a candidate in the remainder of the country.Elections and Events 1850-1899 The Library, UC San Diego As a result, the election was a contest between two Conservative Party candidates, with Julio Arboleda Pombo emerging as the winner.Colombia: Elecciones Presidenciales de 1826 a 1990 Political Database of the Americas ==Results== {| class=wikitable style=text-align:right !Candidate !Party !Votes !% |- |align=left|Julio Arboleda Pombo||align=left|Conservative Party||58,506||73.23 |- |align=left|Pedro Alcántara Herrán||align=left|Conservative Party||21,390||26.77 |- |align=left colspan=2|Total||79,896||100 |- |align=left colspan=4|Source: Political Database of the Americas |} ==References== Category:1860 elections in South America Category:1860 in the Granadine Confederation 1860
title: 1860 Colombian presidential election
